thread.title: Essintial Completes Major Project with a Large U.S. Retailer
thread.title_full: Essintial Completes Major Project with a Large U.S. Retailer

author: Ryan Nagy
title: Essintial Completes Major Project with a Large U.S. Retailer
text:
Essintial Enterprise Solutions, a leading provider of IT infrastructure managed workforce and support services, announced today its successful completion of a large scale, short term technology project with a large U.S. retailer. Essintial was selected as a result of its extensive track record, cutting edge technology and fast, flexible round-the-clock service for large scale technological project deployments. The short term project consisted of the refresh and upgrade of POS hardware at over 800 store locations nationwide. “We have the resources and in-house expertise to implement large scale technology projects in short time frames such as this,” stated Essintial’s CEO, Tom York. “Due to our Managed Workforce™ methodology, we have the proper field service resources ready for large-scale, comprehensive, complex, project deployments.”
Essintial executed over 5,000 field technician touches for this project. Essintial’s Technical Assistance Center (TAC) located in Mechanicsburg, PA had staff working around the clock managing all aspects of the service process. “We are extremely excited about this achievement. This was truly a test of the scalability of our Managed Workforce™ methodology,” said Mr. York.
About Essintial Enterprise Solutions
Privately owned, Essintial Enterprise Solutions is a national provider of IT infrastructure services and support solutions, including its trademarked Managed Workforce offerings. Backed by proprietary, industry leading technology and business analytics capabilities, the company leverages its Technical Assistance Center and network of forward stocking locations to offer solutions that are customized to specific customer requirements, including single implementation and upgrade projects to help enterprises maximize technology availability at the most efficient costs. Learn more at http://www.essintial.com .
